translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Book of Conditional Relations in Reverse Order

analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  upādinnattika hetu duka
translated: The Section on Pairs in Triads

original: Naupādinnupādāniyaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyo hetu dhammo uppajjati🔽hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā cha …pe… āsevane🔽cha …pe… vipāke cha …pe… avigate nava.🔽Naupādinnupādāniyaṁ nanahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyo nahetu dhammo uppajjati🔽hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā aṭṭhārasa, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā ekādasa …pe…
analyzed: na aupādinnupādāniyam na hetum dhammam paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati  hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā cha pe āsevane  cha pe vipāke cha pe avigate nava  na aupādinnupādāniyam na na hetum dhammam paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati  hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā aṭṭhārasa ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā ekādasa pe
translated: With the condition of an object that is clung to and has a condition, there arises a condition that is clung to and has a cause.

original: āsevane cha …pe… vipāke pannarasa …pe… avigate aṭṭhārasa.
analyzed: āsevane cha pe vipāke pannarasa pe avigate aṭṭhārasa
translated: (In brief.)
